intro: Cheiridopsis namaquensis, commonly known as the Namaqua daisy, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its distinctive flowers and adaptations to arid environments. The plant features a low-growing, mat-forming structure with fleshy, blue-green leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with a central disk and ray florets, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires minimal water, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
